fields.summary: Tracer: Build (AS) Tag Editor as angular directive

fields.description: I tried adding the 'Name' tag to an instance when the 'Name' field was blank.  I did not get an error message that told me the Name key was reserved or in use.  If I try to add the Name tag a second time, I get an error that says the key is already in use.  This should be changed so that an error is generated whenever someone tries to use that tag name.  I have included a video of the behavior.
fields.summary: No error if Instance Name tag is used when Name field is blank

comments.body: [~ashamblin], you could fix this when you fix the other, if you'd like. Some resources use a name field, others use a tag and we give it to them as a field in the GUI.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1715

To test visit Create Volume.  Add 'name' to the name field in the tag editor.  Observe error message.  Add Tag button is disabled.

If the tag editor is going to prevent one from using it to edit the Name tag then a message that guides one to the correct place to do that would probably be preferable to simply saying the tag is reserved.

I can enter a tag name of "name" (see attachment). !Name tag error.png|thumbnail!  !No error for name tag.png|thumbnail! 

Is that a problem, [~ccassler]?

While we're waiting to hear back from [~ccassler], [~ashamblin] could you please make the error message even clearer even more grammatical? The field is labeled "Add a tag" with "name..." appearing inside by default (see attachment). !Tag name....png|thumbnail! 

Instead of:

"Name" is a reserved word, please use another key

What do you think of:

"Name" is a reserved tag name. Please use another tag name.

As [~gholms] mentioned, it would be more helpful to point out to people that to change the name of a resource, they should use the Name field instead. Every resource should have a Name field on the detail page, whether that is provided via an actual parameter or a tag. If there is a resource without this field, it should be added, as the first field in the list.
From the movie, it looks like [~ccassler] is writing about the tag names for resources, not the resource names themselves.

Most (but not all) resource names are tags. [~ashamblin] can explain the work done for this ticket, which should make the experience for users transparent and consistent by 1) Presenting a name field for all resources that either accept the name parameter or tags and B) Disallowing the use of name as a tag key.
Reassigned to myself to expedite review.

Hi [~ashamblin], nice job on this so far! I updated the validation error message to help the user know where to update the resource name and pushed the fix to your branch, so please pull. 

I have one concern: The validation seems to be case-sensitive. I would think we would want to reserve Name *and* name, otherwise this could still be confusing to users. Could you make that update, or ping me to discuss, please? Thanks!
Altered directive to optionally allow reserved words to be case-insensitive.  Please review.
Looking good, [~ashamblin]! Thanks for fixing the case thing...ready for code review.

[~ashamblin]: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1715 looks good, but could you resolve the merge conflicts (probably with the manage credentials CSS) and lemme know when those have been resolved?
Verified. The error message was displayed as soon as I typed the reserved tag key "Name".
